subsections.title: Bozeman Overview
highlights: College town with outdoor access, tech, and culture
Home to Montana State University
Gateway to Yellowstone and the Bridger Mountains

subsections.title: Dining & Coffee
highlights: The Western Café – classic Montana breakfast
Jam! – brunch spot with big flavors
Vienne – artisan bakery and coffee
MAP Brewing – local beer with epic mountain views
Blackbird – upscale pizza and seasonal dishes

subsections.title: Breweries & Nightlife
highlights: MAP Brewing – beer + Bridger views
Bozeman Brewing Co. – locals' favorite
Shine & Bozeman Taproom – rooftop hangouts
The Haufbrau & The Molly Brown – dive bar classics
Live music at Rialto, The Elm, and local bars

subsections.title: Hiking & Outdoors
highlights: The M Trail – quick hike with valley views
Drinking Horse – shaded loop with a view
Hyalite Canyon – waterfalls, lakes, snowshoeing
Sypes Canyon & Triple Tree Trail – family friendly
Ski Bridger Bowl (local hill) and Big Sky (1.5 hrs)

subsections.title: Family-Friendly Fun
highlights: Museum of the Rockies – dinosaurs & planetarium
Story Mill Park – nature walks and climbing walls
Bozeman Hot Springs – pools + live music
Sweet Pea Festival – art, food, kid activities (Aug)

subsections.title: Lodging & Neighborhoods
highlights: Downtown hotels – near Main Street dining
Northside motels – budget and basic
Vacation rentals in Bridger Canyon or Four Corners
Element Hotel – eco-conscious downtown stay

subsections.title: Skiing & Winter Sports
highlights: Bridger Bowl – 20 min from downtown, locals' hill
Crosscut Nordic Center – XC skiing and biathlon
Backcountry access in Hyalite & Bridgers
Big Sky Resort – 1.5 hour drive for luxury skiing

subsections.title: Shopping & Markets
highlights: Downtown Bozeman – boutique retail + galleries
Town & Country Foods – local grocery chain
Gallatin Valley Mall – chain stores and cinema
Bozeman Winter Farmers Market – seasonal produce

subsections.title: Events & Culture
highlights: Art Walks (summer) – downtown galleries + wine
Music on Main (Thursdays in July/Aug)
Bozeman Ice Festival (Dec)
Farmer’s Market at Lindley Park (summer Sundays)

subsections.title: Loop Integration & Travel Tips
highlights: Fly into BZN for Yellowstone and Montana access
Great base before heading to Big Sky, Ennis, or Livingston
Expect crowds in summer – book early
Town has expanded – traffic can be heavy near Main St
